archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
name: Portuguese Smoked Hake à Gomes de Sá (Iberian Hake-Potato Bake)
description: A Portuguese-style family casserole of flaked smoked hake baked with potatoes, sweet onions, olives, and sliced eggs, finished with parsley and olive oil. Showstopper presentation in a large baking dish for a weekend feast.
prep_steps: Rinse smoked hake under cold water.
Peel potatoes and cut into 1 cm rounds.
Rinse parsley and roughly chop leaves.
Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the eggs.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the potatoes.
cook_steps: Boil eggs for 10 minutes, cool under cold water, peel, and slice into rounds; set aside.
Simmer smoked hake in a saucepan with enough water to cover and 2 bay leaves for 8–10 minutes until it flakes; drain, discard bay leaves, and flake the fish into large chunks (remove any bones).
Boil potato rounds in salted water for 8–10 minutes until just tender but not falling apart; drain gently.
Heat 1/3 cup olive oil in a large pan over medium heat; cook onions with a pinch of salt for 10–12 minutes until soft and lightly golden. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more.
In a large oiled baking dish, layer half the potatoes, half the onions/garlic, and half the flaked smoked hake. Season lightly with salt and black pepper and scatter half the olives.
Repeat with remaining potatoes, onions/garlic, hake, and olives. Drizzle the remaining olive oil over the top.
Bake uncovered at 200°C (390°F) for 20–25 minutes until edges are sizzling and lightly browned.
Remove from oven; arrange sliced eggs on top, sprinkle with parsley, and finish with a light squeeze of lemon. Rest 5 minutes, then serve.
